intro: Hymenostegia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-stemmed hymenostegia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. This plant is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, lowland forests. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
